title: Face behind hack: US identifies North Korean man behind stolen data from Nasa, military, hospitals; offer $10 million reward
'How can you be childless': Kamala Harris' stepdaughter says she loves three parents
content: ​Ella Emhoff has now come out in the support of stepmother, vice president Kamala Harris in the 'childless cat ladies' row and questioned how can she be "childless" when there are "cutie pie kids" like Cole and herself. She cited her biological mother Kerstin Emhoff's statement issued earlier over the issue as she supporter her 'momala' Kamala.
summary: ​Ella Emhoff has now come out in the support of stepmother, vice president Kamala Harris in the 'childless cat ladies' row and questioned how can she be "childless" when there are "cutie pie kids" like Cole and herself. She cited her biological mother Kerstin Emhoff's statement issued earlier over the issue as she supporter her 'momala' Kamala.

title: 19th-century Baltic shipwreck loaded with champagne uncovered by Polish divers
Elon Musk's daughter reacts to 'killed by woke virus' jibe: 'I disowned him'
content: Vivian Jenna Wilson, Elon Musk's transgender daughter, Thursday reacted to father's recent statement that she has been "killed by the woke-mind virus" and said: 'I look pretty good for a dead bi***". Viviana did not post it on X, his father's company and chose Mark Zuckerberg's Threads to give it back to Elon.
summary: Vivian Jenna Wilson, Elon Musk's transgender daughter, Thursday reacted to father's recent statement that she has been "killed by the woke-mind virus" and said: 'I look pretty good for a dead bi***". Viviana did not post it on X, his father's company and chose Mark Zuckerberg's Threads to give it back to Elon.

title: JD Vance's beard can make history if he's elected. Here's why
content: If Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance is elected as the vice president, then his beard will make history as White House has not seen any man with facial hair in recent past. Donald Trump apparently does not like facial hair but JD Vance's stubble does not irk him, it seems, as Trump complimented his running mate by saying that he looks like "young Abraham Lincoln".
summary: If Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance is elected as the vice president, then his beard will make history as White House has not seen any man with facial hair in recent past. Donald Trump apparently does not like facial hair but JD Vance's stubble does not irk him, it seems, as Trump complimented his running mate by saying that he looks like "young Abraham Lincoln".

title: Hantavirus in US: Deadly rat disease kills four; health officials on alert
A year jail sentence should be given to anyone who desecrates American flag: Trump
content: Former US President Donald Trump suggested a one-year jail term for those desecrating the American flag after protesters burned flags in Washington, D.C. during Israeli PM Netanyahu’s speech. He urged Congress to implement strict penalties, dismissing concerns about constitutionality. House Republicans later replaced the burned flags.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump suggested a one-year jail term for those desecrating the American flag after protesters burned flags in Washington, D.C. during Israeli PM Netanyahu’s speech. He urged Congress to implement strict penalties, dismissing concerns about constitutionality. House Republicans later replaced the burned flags.

title: Kamala Harris Baptist, husband Jewish; her faith traces back to Gandhi, MLK: 10 interesting facts
content: Vice President Kamala Harris represents a fusion of traditions and teachings and has the best of the two worlds, her longtime pastor the Rev. Amos Brown, who leads Third Baptist Church in San Francisco said as Kamala embarks on her presidential election campaign. Kamala is deeply religious and had Brown on phone after President Joe Biden endorsed her for the presidential race. Everyone in her team is well-acquainted with Brown as he is always phone call away.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris represents a fusion of traditions and teachings and has the best of the two worlds, her longtime pastor the Rev. Amos Brown, who leads Third Baptist Church in San Francisco said as Kamala embarks on her presidential election campaign. Kamala is deeply religious and had Brown on phone after President Joe Biden endorsed her for the presidential race. Everyone in her team is well-acquainted with Brown as he is always  phone call away.

title: 'When you have kids...': JD Vance's defence for what he feels for 'childless cat ladies'
content: ​JD Vance is in the center of a major controversy with prominent voiced adding their dissent to what the Republican VP candidate feels about 'childless cat ladies'. Videos have emerged of JD Vance saying he feels that people without child have less stake in the future and so they should not have the same voting rights as the people with children etc. He called Kamala Harris, AOC and Pete Buttigieg 'childless cat ladies' who are running the country.
summary: ​JD Vance is in the center of a major controversy with prominent voiced adding their dissent to what the Republican VP candidate feels about 'childless cat ladies'. Videos have emerged of JD Vance saying he feels that people without child have less stake in the future and so they should not have the same voting rights as the people with children etc. He called Kamala Harris, AOC and Pete Buttigieg 'childless cat ladies' who are running the country.

title: 'Robber grandpas': Elderly trio charged with burglary in Japan
content: Three elderly men in Japan, with a combined age of 227, were arrested for a series of burglaries in Sapporo. They met in prison and stole cash, whiskey, and jewelry. They reportedly broke into an unoccupied house in Sapporo, Hokkaido, in May, stealing 200 yen (US$1.30) and three bottles of whisky valued at 10,000 yen (US$65). The men's motive was reportedly to 'make a living.'
summary: Three elderly men in Japan, with a combined age of 227, were arrested for a series of burglaries in Sapporo. They met in prison and stole cash, whiskey, and jewelry. They reportedly broke into an unoccupied house in Sapporo, Hokkaido, in May, stealing 200 yen (US$1.30) and three bottles of whisky valued at 10,000 yen (US$65).  The men's motive was reportedly to 'make a living.'

title: Exploring Chinese numerology: Lucky numbers, car plates, wedding dates
Russia offers 2 lakh rubles as signing bonus to fight Ukraine war
content: Russia offered financial incentives, including a 195,000 ruble signing bonus and monthly salaries up to 400,000 rubles, to attract new military recruits. The government also appealed to patriotism. This effort aims to counteract manpower shortages amidst ongoing military operations in Ukraine since February 2022.
summary: Russia offered financial incentives, including a 195,000 ruble signing bonus and monthly salaries up to 400,000 rubles, to attract new military recruits. The government also appealed to patriotism. This effort aims to counteract manpower shortages amidst ongoing military operations in Ukraine since February 2022.

title: Southwest Airlines to discontinue open seating policy
content: Southwest Airlines is ending its open seating policy after 50 years, shifting to assigned seating and premium rows. The company cites evolving customer preferences and the need to attract corporate travelers. This change follows pressure from Elliott Investment Management and reflects unsuccessful summer ticket sales affecting profits. Additionally, Southwest will introduce red-eye flights on five routes starting February to boost revenue.
summary: Southwest Airlines is ending its open seating policy after 50 years, shifting to assigned seating and premium rows. The company cites evolving customer preferences and the need to attract corporate travelers. This change follows pressure from Elliott Investment Management and reflects unsuccessful summer ticket sales affecting profits. Additionally, Southwest will introduce red-eye flights on five routes starting February to boost revenue.

title: Deployment of UAE's Mirage fighters bombers in China raises concerns in US
content: The UAE Air Force and China's PLAAF held a joint exercise in Xinjiang, involving Mirage 2000-9 fighter bombers. The event raised US concerns about China getting access to Western military technology. It pointed to stronger UAE-China ties and significant geopolitical shifts. The UAE's inclining towards China had shown Washington about the UAE's level of independence.
summary: The UAE Air Force and China's PLAAF held a joint exercise in Xinjiang, involving Mirage 2000-9 fighter bombers. The event raised US concerns about China getting access to Western military technology. It pointed to stronger UAE-China ties and significant geopolitical shifts. The UAE's inclining towards China had shown Washington about the UAE's level of independence.

title: Catfight in US over childbearing and abortion as election campaign heats up
Not only 'cat ladies', JD Vance once said childless people should not have....
content: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance's childless cat ladies comment targeting Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg and AOC has struck all the wrong chords as the Republican leader is facing a volley of criticism from all quarters -- Jennifer Anniston being the latest. Now another clip has emerged on social media highlighting JD Vance's stand on childless people.

title: Yes, Kamala Harris' first campaign video has Beyonce's 'Freedom'
content: Kamala Harris Thursday released the first video of her presidential campaign and it featured Beyonce's song Freedom. CNN earlier reported that Harris' team reached out to Beyonce to get approval to use that song throughout her presidential campaign. And it was allowed. Quickly.
summary: Kamala Harris Thursday released the first video of her presidential campaign and it featured Beyonce's song Freedom. CNN earlier reported that Harris' team reached out to Beyonce to get approval to use that song throughout her presidential campaign. And it was allowed. Quickly.

title: Jailed Imran Khan to run for Oxford University Chancellor post? Internet can't keep calm
content: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan is reportedly planning to apply for the position of the chancellor at Oxford University after the post became vacant following the resignation of Lord Patten. Imran Khan is in jail on charges of inciting protests and violence against the military last year. Reports said Imran Khan's team cited public demand that he should contest but it will be a tough one as Boris Johnson, Tony Blair -- the former UK PMs -- are also in the race.
summary: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan is reportedly planning to apply for the position of the chancellor at Oxford University after the post became vacant following the resignation of Lord Patten. Imran Khan is in jail on charges of inciting protests and violence against the military last year. Reports said Imran Khan's team cited public demand that he should contest but it will be a tough one as Boris Johnson, Tony Blair -- the former UK PMs -- are also in the race.

title: Climate protest at Frankfurt Airport forces a temporary halt to flights
content: Environmental activists disrupted air travel at Frankfurt Airport by breaching security fences, leading to the cancellation of over 100 flights. The demonstrations aimed to highlight the urgent need to address climate change caused by fossil fuel use. Similar protests occurred across Europe, targeting airports in Finland, Norway, Switzerland, and Spain. Legal actions were planned against the activists.
summary: Environmental activists disrupted air travel at Frankfurt Airport by breaching security fences, leading to the cancellation of over 100 flights. The demonstrations aimed to highlight the urgent need to address climate change caused by fossil fuel use. Similar protests occurred across Europe, targeting airports in Finland, Norway, Switzerland, and Spain. Legal actions were planned against the activists.

title: Why does Nepal suffer so many air crashes?
content: Eighteen people lost their lives in a Kathmandu plane crash, underscoring Nepal’s air safety issues. The country's difficult terrain, outdated aircraft, and inadequate pilot training contribute to frequent incidents. Although the European Union had banned Nepal's airlines since 2013, improvements in aviation regulation have been observed recently.
summary: Eighteen people lost their lives in a Kathmandu plane crash, underscoring Nepal’s air safety issues. The country's difficult terrain, outdated aircraft, and inadequate pilot training contribute to frequent incidents. Although the European Union had banned Nepal's airlines since 2013, improvements in aviation regulation have been observed recently.
